snippet: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said that the leak in question was among the two or three most serious leaks he had seen since the 1970s.
abstract: Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr defends Justice Department's seizure of telephone records of Associated Press journalists, describing article that prompted criminal investigation as among 'the top two or three most serious leaks' he has seen in his 35-year career; 2012 article disclosed foiling of terrorist plot by Al Qaeda's branch in Yemen to bomb airliner.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Christine Haughney contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said that the leak in question was among the two or three most serious leaks he had seen since the 1970s.

headline.seo: Holder Defends Justice Department in Journalists’ Records Seizure
headline.main: Justice Dept. Defends Seizure of Phone Records
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Defends Seizure of Phone Records
